p: Laboratory-hatched female Culex tritaeniorhynchus mosquitoes were fed with 10% sucrose and maintained at 28°C. Mosquitoes were starved for 1 day prior to the blood-feeding experiment. The mosquitoes were fed per os with a JEV viremic blood meal, a mixture of pig blood cells and 8×10 6 ffu/ml of JEV according to the previous study [ 57] and the stock titer of JEVs used in this study. The virus-infected mosquitoes were maintained in the different cage at 28°C. Infected mosquitoes were collected from cages by aspiration and homogenized individually at 14 days post- infection (DPI).
